page.title: 12Stowmarket's Parish Church
page.content: The Church of Saint Peter and Saint Mary occupies a central site; once there were two separate units in this place. Much of the fabric was built in the 14th century, but it was extensivel restored in the 19th century. Great efforts are currently being made to raise money for further repairs. The church has always been deeply involved in the community; bargains made in the market place were sealed in the porch; the vestry was used for meetings about the relief of poverty and the state of the roads; the church provided a school. Nowadays the involvement has changed its character and the present concern is to increase the attendance and participation in church activities.
